meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a boar in behavior or appearance.
meanings.sent1: His boarish grunts could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent2: The boarish man had a rough and wild look about him.
meanings.sent3: The boarish behavior of the toddler made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her boarish determination to win the race was admirable.
meanings.sent5: The boarish nature of the forest creatures was fascinating to observe.

meanings.definition: Rudely or uncouthly aggressive in behavior.
meanings.sent1: She found his boarish manners quite off-putting.
meanings.sent2: The boarish customer yelled at the waiter for no reason.
meanings.sent3: Despite his boarish attitude, he somehow managed to make friends.
meanings.sent4: The boarish boss's sharp words cut through the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The boarish driver aggressively honked at the slow-moving car ahead.
